member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter
member.summary: Class to handle the metering properties and methods common to all supported devices
CANSIDevice class - This is the "device server" for the ANSI device. (IConfiguration implementation)

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter.BornAgain
member.summary: Performs a Born Again on the meter. You must be logged in as a level 5 user in order to perform this operation.
member.returns: A PSEM Response for the write to Table 07

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter.ColdStart
member.summary: Performs a Cold Start (aka three button reset) on the meter. You must be logged in as a level 5 user in order to perform this operation. This function does not have a return value as the meter will not be reset after calling this procedure.
member.returns: A PSEM Response for the write to Table 07

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter.ClearBaseData
member.summary: Performs a clear Base procedure
member.returns: A PSEM Response for the write to Table 07

member.summary: Calls the Seal Canadian procedure

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter.ValidateForTOUReconfigure(System.String,System.String,Itron.Metering.TOU.CTOUSchedule@,Itron.Metering.DST.CDSTSchedule@)
member.summary: Checks to see if the meter's clock is running and if it is configured for DST time adjustment and TOU rates.
member.param: PC-PRO+ TOU schedule file name
PC-PRO+ DST file name (DST.xml). Pass an empty string if the meter doesn't support DST.
Returns an instance of the TOU server with the TOUFileName file open if successful

Returns an instance of the DST server with the DSTFileName file open if successful. NOTE that it is valid to pass an empty DST file name for meters not configured with DST. In that case, the returned DSTSchedule will be null.

members.member:
Clears Table2048.m_CalendarConfig and write the TOU and DST info to it to prepare it for writing to the meter. The CalendarConfig contains season start dates, holdays, and DST dates. The rest of the TOU configuration is in the TOUConfig table.
This method ASSUMES the TOUSchedule and DSTSchedule provided are valid for the meter. If the DSTSchedule object is be null, the meter will not be configured with DST TOU server with a valid TOU file open DST server with a DST file open. Note that this object can be null for meters that will not have DST SUCCESS, ERROR_DST_DATA_MISSING
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/26/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created 10/13/06 mcm 7.35.04 55,64,67 - Insert season start date didn't work

Clears Table2048.m_TOUConfig and writes the TOU scheudule info into the table to prepare it for writing to the meter. The TOUConfig contains configuration data not related to a particular year. This table has the Typical Week and pattern definitions for all of the seasons. The per-year info (season start dates, holdays, and DST dates) are in the CalendarConfig table.
ASSUMES the TOU schedule is valid for this meter TOU server with a supported TOU file open.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/22/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created 10/23/06 mcm 7.35.07 105 Need to add end output switchpoints

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ANSIMeter.FindStartSeason(Itron.Metering.TOU.CTOUSchedule,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the index of the season that should be in effect at the start the new configuration. Customers usually have a Summer and Winter season. They expect Winter to be in effect until Summer starts that first year, but it won't be unless we insert a start date. This method ASSUMES that every year has a season start date.
member.param: TOU server with the schedule open
Index of the first year to configure
member.returns: The season index that should be used on 1/1 of the first year.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS
member.summary: Firmware download status and progress history

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.Unknown
member.summary: Initial status of a device that never entered download mode. Not indicative of whether the device supports FW download or not.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.BadFileSize
member.summary: File size was not correct. Device will not support download of this image

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.BadHWRevision
member.summary: Hardware Revision was not correct. Device will not support download of this image

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.BadHWVersion
member.summary: Hardware version was not correct. Device will not support download of this image

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.BadFWType
member.summary: Firmware type was incorrect. HAN device failed to activate the image.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.BadCRC
member.summary: HAN device failed to activate the image due to a bad CRC32.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.RetryFailed
member.summary: This status is set after receiving a device deemed to fail due to excessive image errors.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.InsufficientBlocks
member.summary: HAN device has incomplete image. Device failed.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.DownloadInProgress
member.summary: This status will be set by the electric meter to indicate that the device is the one actively downloading firmware

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.InvalidFWType
member.summary: Firmware type was invalild. Device will not support download of this image.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.InvalidDeviceClass
member.summary: Device class was incorrect. Device will not support download of this image.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.InitiateFailure
member.summary: After trying to initiate download twice with a device known to support FW download, if no response is heard, the device is moved to this status. Device will not support download.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.VersionRunning
member.summary: HAN device is operating with the firmware version that the electric meter is trying to download.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.VersionDownloaded
member.summary: The next step would be to send time at the next communication with the device, and promote it to READY FOR ACTIVATION

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.VoltageOutOfRange
member.summary: This is a fatal error that is reported to the head end. The HAN module and electric meter shall abort download.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.FlashWriteFailure
member.summary: This is a fatal error that is reported to the head end. The HAN module and the electric meter shall abort download.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.DownloadSetup
member.summary: This status is set starting/resuming a download

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.SuccessfulEndOfTransfer
member.summary: This status is set when a HAN module responds to the last packet of the last page of the image with a Load Image Packet Response, but before a Download Complete Response is received by the electric meter.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.ActivationSent
member.summary: This status is set after sending Activate Download Command.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.Activating
member.summary: The HAN device shuts radio off and does image CRC check. Upon waking up, the HAN device will join the same electric meter hopefully and we will expect 'Version Running', 'Bad CRC', or 'Bad FW Type'.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.Paused
member.summary: This status is set when a HAN module responds to a Pause command, or if the IDLE_WAKEUP_SENT timer expires while the HAN module is in SYNC_PACKET_SENT status and no Load Image Packet Response is heard back. This status is also set if a magnet swipe occurs at the gas module, or if the meter cannot download to the gas module because there is another ongoing download.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.ResyncNeeded
member.summary: This status is set after failing to receive a Load Image Packet Response at the end of the page within an IDLE_PAGE_SEND_TIMER timer expires.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.SyncPacketSent
member.summary: This status is set after sending a HAN module a wake up packet when the IDLE_PAGE_SEND_TIMER timer expires.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.ReadyForActivation
member.summary: This status is set after sending a HAN module a Set Time command if it was in VERSION DOWNLOADED. The HAN module must be in READY FOR ACTIVATION before an Activate Download Command can be sent

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.HAN_FW_DL_STATUS.HeadEndCancellation
member.summary: This status is set when a HAN module is sent a Cancel by the Head End, and validated when it responds with a Stop Download Response.

member.summary: This method will validate any of the 4 types of security keys
member.param: The type of key: Enhanced Security, C1218 Passwords, C1222 Keys, or HAN Keys

For the given key type, which key to validate: 1 = "Command Key 1/C1218 Primary PWD/C1222 Key 1/HAN Network Key", 2 = "Command Key 2/C1218 Secondary PWD/C1222 Key 2/HAN Global Link Key", 3 = "Command Key 3/C1218 Tertiary PWD/C1222 Key 3", 4 = "Command Key 4/C1218 Quaternary PWD/C1222 Key 4", 5 = "Revocation Key 1", 6 = "Revocation Key 2"
The hashed value of the key to validate

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.SetCollectionConfig(System.UInt64,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Configures how the Gas/Water meter is to collect its meter data
member.param: MAC address of the client to which to send the command
Daily Freeze Hour - the hour at which the daily consumption readings are read
0x00 => Current Consumption and DFT readings, 0x01 => Hourly interval data, 0x02 => Daily Interval data

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.SetDataDeliveryConfig(System.UInt64,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: This command configures the schedule by which the Gas/Water meter will wake up and send its meter data to the electric meter
member.param: MAC address of the client to which to send the command
Hour for wake up and data delivery: midnight is 0, 11 pm is 23
Whether the client should wake up once or twice a day. 1 => every 12 hours; 0 => every 24 hours.

member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CENTRON_AMI.DownloadFW(System.String,System.UInt16@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call on success. This method supports resuming a previous failed FWDL.
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

Dual purpose parameter. The passed in value indicates which block to begin downloading. The passed out parameter indicates which block to resume downloading in case there was a failure. This can then passed in again to restart the download at the point where it left off.
Whether or not to leave the FWDL in a state to permit subsequent retries at point of faliure. If false the pending table will be cleared on failure.
Whether or not to activate the firmware.

members.member:
Publishes a HAN message to any devices bound to the Messaging cluster
Number to identify the message (duplicate Message IDs may be ignored by the end devices) When the message will become active How long from the start time the message will be able to be retrieved by an end device Message Transmission values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 0 and 1 of MSG_CTRL Message Priority values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 2 and 3 of MSG_CTRL Whether confirmation is required from end devices upon receipt of this message The actual text to send to the end device PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure) Revision History

Publishes a HAN pricing table to any devices bound to the Pricing cluster by doing a full write to the Pricing table after a full read and overwriting the price at index - PriceIndex
An instance of an AMIHANPriceEntryRcd which contains the pricing data to send Index of which price to write over in the HAN pricing table PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure) Revision History

member.summary: The Constructor. Used to access common FWDL methods and properites. Usually instantiated by classes that are implementing the IFirmwareDownload Interface. At this time it only applies to ICS Gateway devices.
member.param: The PSEM object to be used in the class.
The ANSIDevice to be used in the class.
The DebugLogger to be used in the class.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CommonFirmwareDownload.DownloadFWBlocks(System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method just downloads the firmware file blocks to the device for a given range of blocks. Use 1-based indexing for blocks.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file
The first block to download.
The last block to download.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CommonFirmwareDownload.DownloadFWNoActivate(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the device but does NOT activate. On download failure, the pending table is cleared.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CommonFirmwareDownload.DownloadFWNoActivate(System.String,Itron.Metering.Device.PendingEventRecord.PendingEventCode)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the device but does NOT activate. On download failure, the pending table is cleared.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file
event code activation method

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CommonFirmwareDownload.DownloadFW(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CommonFirmwareDownload.DownloadFW(System.String,System.UInt16@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call on success. This method supports resuming a previous failed FWDL.
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

Dual purpose parameter. The passed in value indicates which block to begin downloading. The passed out parameter indicates which block to resume downloading in case there was a failure. This can then passed in again to restart the download at the point where it left off.
Whether or not to leave the FWDL in a state to permit subsequent retries at point of faliure. If false the pending table will be cleared on failure.
Whether or not to activate the firmware.

member.summary: Translates a PSEMResponse into a FWDownloadResult
member.param: PSEMResponse - enumerates all possible results or errors that could be returned from the PSEM layer
member.returns: result codes specific to firmware download

member.summary: Translates a ProcedureResultCodes into a FWDownloadResult

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.ICS_Gateway.FWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the firmware revision. This is the same as "FWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different firmware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. This allows us to override only a property and not the creation of a table.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.ICS_Gateway.HWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the hardware revision. This is the same as "HWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different hardware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. Reference table 2128 for example.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRU.DownloadFWNoActivate(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the device but does NOT activate. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRU.DownloadFW(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if possible. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task; therefore, a log off the meter is necessary after calling this method.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRU.DownloadFW(System.String,System.UInt16@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call on success. This method supports resuming a previous failed FWDL.
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

Dual purpose parameter. The passed in value indicates which block to begin downloading. The passed out parameter indicates which block to resume downloading in case there was a failure. This can then passed in again to restart the download at the point where it left off.
Whether or not to leave the FWDL in a state to permit subsequent retries at point of faliure. If false the pending table will be cleared on failure.
Whether or not to activate the firmware.

member.summary: Publishes a HAN message to any devices bound to the Messaging cluster
member.param: Number to identify the message (duplicate Message IDs may be ignored by the end devices)
When the message will become active
How long from the start time the message will be able to be retrieved by an end device
Message Transmission values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 0 and 1 of MSG_CTRL

Whether confirmation is required from end devices upon receipt of this message

Publishes a HAN pricing table to any devices bound to the Pricing cluster by doing a full write to the Pricing table after a full read and overwriting the price at index - PriceIndex
An instance of an AMIHANPriceEntryRcd which contains the pricing data to send Index of which price to write over in the HAN pricing table PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure) Revision History

member.summary: This method just downloads the firmware file blocks to the device for a given range of blocks. Use 1-based indexing for blocks.

The first block to download.
The last block to download.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRV.DownloadFWNoActivate(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the device but does NOT activate. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRV.DownloadFW(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if possible. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task; therefore, a log off the meter is necessary after calling this method.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRV.DownloadFW(System.String,System.UInt16@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call on success. This method supports resuming a previous failed FWDL.
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

Dual purpose parameter. The passed in value indicates which block to begin downloading. The passed out parameter indicates which block to resume downloading in case there was a failure. This can then passed in again to restart the download at the point where it left off.
Whether or not to leave the FWDL in a state to permit subsequent retries at point of faliure. If false the pending table will be cleared on failure.
Whether or not to activate the firmware.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayITRV.PublishHANMessage(System.UInt32,System.DateTime,System.UInt16,System.Byte,Itron.Metering.DeviceDataTypes.AMIHANMsgRcd.MessagePriority,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Publishes a HAN message to any devices bound to the Messaging cluster
member.param: Number to identify the message (duplicate Message IDs may be ignored by the end devices)
When the message will become active
How long from the start time the message will be able to be retrieved by an end device
Message Transmission values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 0 and 1 of MSG_CTRL
Message Priority values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 2 and 3 of MSG_CTRL
Whether confirmation is required from end devices upon receipt of this message
The actual text to send to the end device
member.returns: PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure)

members.member:
Publishes a HAN pricing table to any devices bound to the Pricing cluster by doing a full write to the Pricing table after a full read and overwriting the price at index - PriceIndex
An instance of an AMIHANPriceEntryRcd which contains the pricing data to send Index of which price to write over in the HAN pricing table PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure) Revision History

members.member:
The PasswordReconfigResult reconfigures passwords. Requires primary password level access. This method resets all passwords to null and then sets up to 4 passwords starting with the primary password.
A list of passwords to write to the meter. The Primary password should be listed first followed by the secondary password and so on. Use empty strings for null passwords. Passwords will be truncated or null filled as needed to fit in the device. A PasswordReconfigResult object

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CANSIDevice.Register
member.summary: The Registration service is used to add and maintain (keep-alive) routing information of C12.22 Relays. To be part of C12.22 Network, a node shall send a registration service to one of the C12.22 Relays. This procedure, typically used on the local port (ANSI C12.18), is used to initiate this process

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CANSIDevice.RegisterAndWaitForResult
member.summary: The Registration service is used to add and maintain (keep-alive) routing information of C12.22 Relays. To be part of C12.22 Network, a node shall send a registration service to one of the C12.22 Relays. This procedure, typically used on the local port (ANSI C12.18), is used to initiate this process

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CANSIDevice.Deregister
member.summary: The deregistration service is used to remove routing information in C12.22 Relays. This procedure, typically used on the local port (ANSI C12.18), is used to initiate this process

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.CANSIDevice.DeregisterAndWaitForResult
member.summary: The deregistration service is used to remove routing information in C12.22 Relays. This procedure, typically used on the local port (ANSI C12.18), is used to initiate this process

member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 05/11/07 mcm 8.10.04 Created 07/02/09 AF 2.20.11 137349 Removed CUST_SCHED_CHANGED because this event as a different meaning for OpenWay devices 10/13/09 MMD 2.30.09 141987 Changed the string representation of LOSS_VOLTAGE_A from LOSS_OF_POTENTIAL to LOSS_OF_PHASE 05/11/10 jrf 2.41.01 Adding the Table Configuration event. 06/15/16 MP 4.50.284 WR680128 Promoted On Demand Periodic Read from base dictionary. 07/12/16 MP 4.70.7 WR688986 Changed how event descriptions were accessed 07/14/16 MP 4.70.7 WR688986 Removed commented code

member.summary: This struct is used if the table 51 Separate Weekdays Flag is true; i.e., the meter supports separate schedules for each weekday.

member.summary: This structure represents a C12.19 table 54 CALENDAR_RCD. The Anchor Date may or may not be there depending on the table 51 ANCHOR_DATE_FLAG. The sizes of the arrays depends on various table 51 flags.

member.summary: If specified, any recurring date using the period/offset type shall use this date as a starting point

member.summary: Array containing non-recurring dates

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.CALENDAR_RCD.RecurringDates
member.summary: Array containing recurring dates

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.CALENDAR_RCD.TierSwitches
member.summary: Array that contains the tier switches

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.CALENDAR_RCD.DailyScheduleIDMatrix
member.summary: 2-dimensional array containing daily schedule type identifiers. TODO - I'm not sure this is the right data structure to hold the daily schedule matrix. Would it be any better to have 2 1-dimensional arrays -- one an array of WEEKDAY_SCHEDULE_RCD and one, an array of FULL_WEEKDAY_SCHEDULE_RCD?

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.Boolean,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Constructs a table 54 CALENDAR_RCD based on table 51 values.
member.param: Table 51 SEPARATE_SUM_DEMANDS_FLAG. Determines whether or not end device is switching summation and demands independently.
Table 51 ANCHOR_DATE_FLAG. Whether or not end device accepts an anchor date for the Period/Delta RDATE type
Table 51 NBR_NON_RECURR_DATES. Actual number of nonrecurring dates supported by the end device calendar
Table 51 NBR_RECURR_DATES. Actual number of recurring dates supported by the end device calendar
Table 51 NBR_TIER_SWITCHES. Actual number of tier switches supported by the end device calendar
Table 51 SEPARATE_WEEKDAYS_FLAG. Whether or not device is capable of having a different schedule for each of the 5 weekdays
Table 51 NBR_SEASONS. Actual number of seasons in use by the end device
Table 51 NBR_SPECIAL_SCHED. Actual number of special schedules in use by the end device

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.NbrNonRecurringDates
member.summary: Table 51 NBR_NON_RECURR_DATES - actual number of non-recurring dates supported by the end device calendar

member.summary: Table 51 NBR_RECURR_DATES - actual number of recurring dates supported by the end device calendar

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.NbrTierSwitches
member.summary: Table 51 NBR_TIER_SWITCHES - actual number of tier switches supported by the end device calendar

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.C1219_CalendarRcd.AnchorDate
member.summary: Table 54 ANCHOR_DATE - If specified, any recurring date using the PERIOD/OFFSET type shall use this date as a starting date

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ICSCommModule.InitiateFileRetrieval(System.String,System.UInt32@,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Method that initiates the retrieval of a selected ICM debug log
member.param: null terminated ASCII string containing the path and file name of the file on the ICM's file system that we want to retrieve. It's this file's data that will be rendered into MFG table 497
total size in bytes of the file being requested. If this parameter is zero, then the file being requested either does not exist, or otherwise cannot be retrieved

total size in bytes of the valid data renedered into MFG table 497. If the FileTotalSize parameter is less than MFG table 494 FileRetrievalSize, then only the first FileRetrievalSize bytes are rendered into MFG table 497. We will need to call ContinueFileRetrieval to get the next "block" of bytes from the file
MD5 of the data rendered into MFG table 497. Use this to validate the integrity of the file data.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.ICSCommModule.ContinueFileRetrieval(System.Byte,System.UInt16@,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Method to continue the retrieval of an ICM debug log in the case that the log is too large to retrieve in one go
member.param: determines the operation requested. 1 = "Render Next", 2 = "Re-Render Current"
total size in bytes of the valid data rendered into MFG table 497
MD5 of the dta rendered into MFG table 497

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.RFLANCommModule.SetRFLANLevel(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the cell switch parameter selection in the expansion control bits of mfg table 73. We want to set bits 4 and 5 in the expansion control bits byte and leave the rest of the bits unchanged. Of the 4 possible combinations, only 2 and 3 should be allowed. Other values have not been tested. Hysteresis=400;Level=0;GPD=0;CSI=128 (00) Hysteresis=500;Level=64;GPD=1;CSI=128 (01) Hysteresis=400;Level=64;GPD=1;CSI=128 (10) Hysteresis=400;Level=0;GPD=1;CSI=128 (11)
member.param: cell switch parameter value. Only 2 and 3 are allowed

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.RFLANCommModule.RFLANLevelFromOffsetRead
member.summary: Property to retrieve the RFLAN level directly instead of through the display vendor field 1. It should not be used elsewhere unless a conscience decision is made to use this value instead of the level returned from the vendor field. Using it could create a discrepancy in the level shown to the user. Use the property, CommModuleLevel, instead.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.RFLANCommModule.RFLANLevelNoRead

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.M2_Gateway.FWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the firmware revision. This is the same as "FWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different firmware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. This allows us to override only a property and not the creation of a table.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.M2_Gateway.HWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the hardware revision. This is the same as "HWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different hardware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. Reference table 2128 for example.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.M2_Gateway.FirmwareBuild
member.summary: Gets the firmware build (without using a LID request)
member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.SL7000_Gateway.FWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the firmware revision. This is the same as "FWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different firmware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. This allows us to override only a property and not the creation of a table.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.SL7000_Gateway.HWRevisionForTableCreation
member.summary: Gets the hardware revision. This is the same as "HWRevision" but was created for the purpose of using as a parameter to pass in on table creation. Some Tables are different sizes in different hardware versions. This should only be used as a parameter to pass in when creating a table. Reference table 2128 for example.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.MFGTable2061CanadianConfig.CanadianMeter
member.summary: This property gets/sets the Canadian Meter. Setting this property will write the value to the table and cause the meter to 3 button reset after logging off. This changes a meter into a Canadian Meter.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.MFGTable2061CanadianConfig.CanadianSealed
member.summary: This property gets/sets the Canadian Seal. Setting this property will write the value to the table and cause the meter to 3 button reset after logging off. Once a meter is converted to Canadian, then it is sealed to stop changes to various tables as outlined OpenWay Centron Candian Firmware Design by Dan Fasalino

member.summary: Voltage Monitoring is enabled.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2154.VhLowThreshold
member.summary: An integer value representing the low threshold percentage related to the nominal Volt hour in an interval. An event is triggered if the volt hour value for Voltage Monitoring interval duration is below this threshold x nominal Vh.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2154.VhHighThreshold
member.summary: An integer value representing the high threshold percentage related to the nominal Volt hour in an interval. An event is triggered if the volt hour value for Voltage Monitoring interval duration is above this threshold x nominal Vh.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2154.RMSVoltLowThreshold
member.summary: An integer value [0, 100] representing the low threshold percentage related to the nominal voltage. An event is triggered if minimum instantaneous RMS voltage during Voltage Monitoring interval duration is below this threshold x nominal voltage for a configurable number of seconds.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2154.RMSVoltHighThreshold
member.summary: An integer value [0, 100] representing the high threshold percentage related to the nominal voltage. An event is triggered if minimum instantaneous RMS voltage during Voltage Monitoring interval duration is above this threshold x nominal voltage for a configurable number of seconds.

member.summary: The maximum number of blocks that can be contained in the data table.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2155.NumberValidBlocks
member.summary: The number of valid voltage monitoring data blocks in the data table. The range is zero (meaning no blocks in the VM data table) to the actual dimension of the number of VM data blocks. The block is considered valid when at least one interval is written.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2155.LastBlock
member.summary: Array element of the newest valid data block in the Voltage Monitoring data array. This field is valid only if the number of valid blocks is greater than zero.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2155.LastBlockSequenceNumber
member.summary: Sequence number of the last block. It continues to increment even if it exceeds the maximum number of blocks available in storage memory.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.OpenWayMFGTable2155.NumberValidIntervals
member.summary: Number of valid intervals stored in the last Voltage Monitoring block array. The range is zero (meaning no interval in the array) to the actual dimension of the number of intervals per block.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.IHANInformation.PublishHANMessage(System.UInt32,System.DateTime,System.UInt16,System.Byte,Itron.Metering.DeviceDataTypes.AMIHANMsgRcd.MessagePriority,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Publishes a HAN message to any devices bound to the Messaging cluster
member.param: Number to identify the message (duplicate Message IDs may be ignored by the end devices)
When the message will become active
How long from the start time the message will be able to be retrieved by an end device
Message Transmission values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 0 and 1 of MSG_CTRL
Message Priority values as defined in the ZigBee Smart Energy profile spec. Bits 2 and 3 of MSG_CTRL
Whether confirmation is required from end devices upon receipt of this message
The actual text to send to the end device
member.returns: PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure)

members.member:
Publishes a HAN pricing table to any devices bound to the Pricing cluster by doing a full write to the Pricing table after a full read and overwriting the price at index - PriceIndex
An instance of an AMIHANPriceEntryRcd which contains the pricing data to send Index of which price to write over in the HAN pricing table PSEM Response from the Table write. (This table write is caught by the Zigbee tick and is not a Procedure) Revision History

members.member:
This method does the work of writing a lid to table 2049 and reading the results from table 2050.
It is up to the calling method to translate the data. This method always sets the mode to DataOnly.
Also, it is up to the calling method to perform the PSEM wait.
The requested LID The data returned from the device PSEMResponse returned from the device Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 05/23/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 09/27/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Add RequestMode

This method does the work of writing a lid to table 2049 and reading the results from table 2050.
It is up to the calling method to translate the data. This method always sets the mode to DataOnly.
Also, it is up to the calling method to perform the PSEM wait.
The requested LID Request Mode The data returned from the device PSEMResponse returned from the device Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 05/23/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 09/27/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Add RequestMode

This method does the work of writing multiple lids to table 2049 and reading the results from table 2050. It can handle up to 8 lids.
It is up to the calling method to translate the data. This method always sets the mode to DataOnly.
Also, it is up to the calling method to perform the PSEM wait.
The requested LIDs, up to 8 The data returned from the device PSEMResponse returned from the device Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 05/23/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 09/27/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Add RequestMode

This method does the work of writing multiple lids to table 2049 and reading the results from table 2050. It can handle up to 8 lids.
It is up to the calling method to translate the data. This method always sets the mode to DataOnly.
Also, it is up to the calling method to perform the PSEM wait.
The requested LIDs, up to 8 Request Mode The data returned from the device PSEMResponse returned from the device Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 05/23/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 09/27/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Add RequestMode 10/04/06 RCG 7.40.00 N/A Added check to see if the data is null before creating the BinaryReader to avoid an exception

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.DefinedLIDs
member.summary: This class describes the LID supported by the ANSI meter. It is the base class for all LIDs. The Sentinel and Centron meters overrides this class to add support for LIDs which are different between meters.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.REGISTER
member.summary: Std procedure 23, typically used on the local port, is used to initiate the registration service. The Registration service is used to add and maintain (keep-alive) routing information of C12.22 Relays. To be part of C12.22 Network, a node shall send a registration service to one of the C12.22 Relays.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.DEREGISTER
member.summary: Std procedure 24, deregister the node on the network. The deregistration service is used to remove routing information in C12.22 Relays. This procedure, typically used on the local port (ANSI C12.18), is used to initiate this process

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.ADD_AMI_HAN_DEVICE
member.summary: MFG procedure 63 - Preloads the register with the information it needs to allow a new device to join the HAN. The 2 parameters are: Device EUI - UINT64, EUI of the device added Preconfigured Key - BINARY(16), the initial link key for this device

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.RESET_LAN_HAN_COMM_LOGS
member.summary: MFG procedure 65 - Clears the LAN and HAN communication logs. This will reset both the HAN2 upstream and downstream logs if they exist.

member.summary: MFG procedure 69 - Activate a firmware download pending table.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.KEY_INJECTION_PROCEDURE
member.summary: Mfg procedure 75 - Key injection procedure. This should be used for automated testing ONLY.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.UPDATE_TEMPERATURE_OFFSET
member.summary: MFG procedure 76 - Update temperature offset. Allows us to write the offset to factory data without causing a cold start

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.HAN_CERTIFICATE_UPDATE
member.summary: MFG procedure 77 - This procedure saves a new set of ECC certificate and keys into dataflash. It is used to load the Zigbee MCU and the Register with information it needs to perform a Certificate Based Key Establishment with Smart Energy devices supporting it. The 4 parameters are: Device Certificate - UINT8[48], ECC certificate (meter specific). CA Public Key - UINT8[22], ECC public key (not meter specific). Device Private Key = UINT8[21], ECC private key (meter specific). Flags = UINT8, Not used but set to 0x00.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.FORCE_TIME_SYNC
member.summary: MFG procedure 78 - Forces the meter to synchronize its time with the RFLAN if the meter's time is out of sync by a value greater than hysteresis. The parameter is: Hysteresis - UINT16, the value, in seconds, that the meter's time must be out of sync more than for the time sync to succeed.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.SERVICE_LIMITING_FAIL_SAFE
member.summary: MFG procedure 80 - This function allows the user to start, extend, or cancel a service limiting failsafe period. The parameter is the two byte unsigned number of minutes for the failsafe period to continue. The specified duration starts when the message is received. timeInFailSafe - UINT16, the value, in minutes, that the meter must be in failsafe.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.ENTER_EXIT_TEST_MODE
member.summary: MFG procedure 81 - This function allows the user to enter or exit test mode This method takes 4 parameters, test mode type, duration in test mode, test mode quantity and test mode kh value based on the meter form

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.VALIDATE_SECURITY_DATA
member.summary: MFG procedure 83 - Allows the user to validate security keys This procedure takes 3 parameters, security type, key id, and the hash of the specified key. The meter responds with a PROC_COMPLETE if the validation passes. Otherwise the meter responds with a PROC_INV_PARM if the validation fails

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.ENCRYPT_C1218_PASSWORDS
member.summary: MFG procedure 84 - Allows the user to encrypt the C12.18 passwords stored in the meter. This procedure takes no parameters. The meter responds with a PROC_COMPLETE if the encryption procedure is successful. If any of the encyrption functions fail it responds with ERR_CNST.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.AUTHENTICATE
member.summary: MFG procedure 85 - Issue Signed Authorization. Takes the authorization key as a paramter. Returns PROC_COMPLETE if successful, PROC_NO_AUTH if it can not be processed, PROC_INV_PARM if the key is not valid, PROC_CONFLICT if the meter is not set up to use Signed Authorization, or PROC_IN_PROCESS if the command is still processing.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.Procedures.DISABLE_SIGNED_AUTHORIZATION
member.summary: MFG Procedure 87 - Disables Signed Authorization for a specified amount of time.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable08
member.summary: The CTable08 class handles the reading of procedure responses from ANSI table 08. This table should be created once for every procedure that is to be read.

members.member:
This method reads the response in table 08 for a procedure that was executed by writing to the table 07. It overrides the base class read method.
A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request. (PSEM errors). It will return OK if the read is a success and we get a response. The client will need to interpret the response code and response data.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType
member.summary: Power Quality Event type is a binary value defined as follows: 0 = Sag 1 = Swell 2 = Interruption 3 = Voltage Unbalance 4 = Current Unbalance 5 = Excursion 6..7 = Undefined

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.Sag
member.summary: Sag event occurs when voltage drops below a configured value

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.Swell
member.summary: Swell event occurs when voltage rises above a configured value

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.Interruption
member.summary: Interruption event occurs when voltage drops below a configured value for a configured duration

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.VoltageUnbalance
member.summary: Voltage Unbalance event occurs when a phase voltage drops below a configured difference from the average voltage.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.CurrentUnbalance
member.summary: Current Unbalance event occurs when a phase current drops below a configured difference from the average current.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Device.PQEventType.Excursion
member.summary: An Excursion is when the entire family goes on holiday

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent
member.summary: Structure representing a single Power Quality Event. Note that this struct is set up to match the Sentinel Saturn's PQ events. It does not currently support dynamic structuring based on the table 2069 parameters.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.#ctor(System.Byte,System.UInt32,System.Single,System.Single,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Constructs a PowerQualityEvent
member.param: EventType
Duration
EventData1
EventData2
Event end time

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Duration
member.summary: Event duration in miliseconds

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Data1
member.summary:
Event Data is particular to the event type. If EVENT_TYPE is a sag, swell, interruption, or excursion then this field represents the minimum or maximum voltage amplitude during power quality event. If EVENT_TYPE is a voltage unbalance then this field represents the average voltage during the power quality event.
Use the EventData1Description property to get a nicely formatted description of the data.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Data1Description
member.summary: Event Data is particular to the event type. This property returns the Event Data formatted with the units and type of value. For example, event data 1 for a Sag event would be "116.4 V min".
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 02/13/07 mcm 8.0.11 N/A Created 03/12/07 mcm 8.00.18 2561 0 values are not formatted correctly

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Data2
member.summary:
Event Data is particular to the event type. If EVENT_TYPE is a sag, swell, interruption, or excursion then this field represents the peak current during the power quality event. If EVENT_TYPE is a current unbalance or a voltage unbalance then this field represents the peak percent deviation during the power quality event.
Use the EventData2Description property to get a nicely formatted description of the data.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Data2Description
member.summary: Event Data is particular to the event type. This property returns the Event Data formatted with the units and type of value. For example, event data 2 for a Sag event would be "14.378 A".
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 02/13/07 mcm 8.0.11 N/A Created 03/12/07 mcm 8.00.18 2561 0 values are not formatted correctly

member.summary: Event End Time

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.StartTime
member.summary: Returns the calculated event start time based on the end time and the event duration.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.PowerQualityEvent.Type
member.summary: Event type is a binary value defined as follows: 0 = Sag 1 = Swell 2 = Interruption 3 = Voltage Unbalance 4 = Current Unbalance 5 = Excursion 6..7 = Undefined

member.summary: Returns the PQEventType in string form

member.summary: Gets the offset for option board in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the caller should know that the option board is not configured.
member.returns: The offset to the billing schedule config block
member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2048Header.IOOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset for IO in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the caller should know that the IO is not configured.

member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2048Header.BillingSchedOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset for billing schedule in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the caller should know that the read failed.
member.returns: The offset to the billing schedule config block
member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2048Header.CalendarOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset for CalendarOffset in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the either the read failed or this is a pre-Saturn SENTINEL that doesn't have DST or TOU configured (it might still have a clock).
member.returns: The offset to the billing schedule config block
member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2048Header.TOUOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset for TOUOffset in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the either the read failed or the meter is not configured for TOU.
member.returns: The offset to the billing schedule config block
member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2048Header.DisplayOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset for DisplayOffset in 2048. If a 0 offset is returned then the either the read failed or the meter is not configured for Display.

member.exception: Throws: TimeoutException for Timeouts PSEMException for other communication errors.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.ConstantsConfig
member.summary: This ConstantsConfig class handles the reading/writing of the the constants config block of 2048. The reading of this table in the meter will be implicit while the writing of this table will need to be explicitly called. (read/write)
member.remarks: This class is specific to the Sentinel meter. The Image meters use an inherited class. The fields of the table should be defined here. The sizes of the fields are defined in this base class or the inherited class.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Device.CTable2084
member.summary: The CTable2084 class handles the reading of MFG Table 2084 (MCS). The reading of this table in the meter will be implicit. (read-only)
member.remarks:
This table is only supported by meters which have the MCS MeterKey bit set.
This table currently only supports a partial read of this table. It reads the status field only.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.AnsiTable.Write
member.summary: Writes the table's data to the meter. If the write succeeds, the table will be marked as Loaded.
member.remarks: No checking is done to see if the table is Loaded or Dirty before writing it to the meter, so you can write a 0 filled, Unloaded table if you weren't careful or really wanted to.

member.remarks: No checking is done to see if the table is Loaded or Dirty before writing it to the meter, so you can write a 0 filed, Unloaded data if you weren't careful or really wanted to.
member.param: 0 based byte offset to start writing from
the number of bytes to write

members.member:
The C12.19 TABLE_IDB represented as an unsigned, 16 bit integer. Note that the MFG bit is rolled into the value so MFG table 0 is interpretted as Table 2048.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/08/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created

Tables are Unloaded, Loaded, or Dirty. Unloaded tables have never been read or written to. Loaded tables are synchronized with the meter. Dirty tables are usually in a mixed state prior to writing.
This property does not depend on the loaded/unloaded/dirty state of the table.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/09/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created 03/09/07 mcm 8.00.17 2574 Added Set property so owners can make it dirty

members.member:
Interface which needs to be implemented by devices capable of supporting the download of firmware to the meter.
Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ----------------------------------------- 08/09/06 AF 7.35.00 N/A Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.IFirmwareDownload.DownloadFW(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if possible. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task; therefore, a log off the meter is necessary after calling this method.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.IFirmwareDownload.DownloadFWNoActivate(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the device but does NOT activate. On download failure, the pending table is cleared, if.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.IFirmwareDownload.DownloadFWBlocks(System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: This method just downloads the firmware file blocks to the device for a given range of blocks. Use 1-based indexing for blocks.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file
The first block to download.
The last block to download.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Device.IFirmwareDownload.DownloadFW(System.String,System.UInt16@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Downloads the firmware file to the meter and activates it. The activation will cause the meter to drop the psem task so meter log off must follow this function call on success. This method supports resuming a previous failed FWDL attempt.
member.param: Complete file path of the firmware file

Dual purpose parameter. The passed in value indicates which block to begin downloading. The passed out parameter indicates which block to resume downloading in case there was a failure. This can then passed in again to restart the download at the point where it left off.
Whether or not to leave the FWDL in a state to permit subsequent retries at point of faliure. If false the pending table will be cleared on failure.
Whether or not to activate the firmware.
